title: Remote Tech Chat Window left open, main window with 1200 synced tabs closed, need synced tabs back
content:
A remote tech was logged in to my machine and had a chat window (Firefox window) opened. My main Firefox window was also opened as it always is. My main firefox window had approximately 1200 tabs that were synced and have been opening when I open firefox for more than a year. Most of these tabs were very important. Well the main Firefox window was closed with the secondary chat window still opened. Just like that, my massively important 1200 synced tabs were gone!!! Can someone please tell me how to recover them. The tech did open a few blank tabs once i pointed out what had been done. How can I recover all of those tabs?

Secondly, can a synced tab session be saved (or backed up) as you used to be able to do in the early days of tabs / session manager?

And finally, I need to have my internal drive replaced, is there some way that I can save my open / synced tabs for restoring on new drive after windows reload? Thank you

title: Gestion des périphériques de sécurité
content:
Bonjour,

J'utilise un certificat RGS** sur clé usb pour administrer différentes plateformes métiers. Depuis la version 70 de Firefox, la requête "Digital Signature PIN" est demandée de manière intempestive. On met le code PIN une première fois, puis parfois jusqu'à 10 fois de suite ce code est redemandé. Il est tout de même enregistré puisqu'on peut annuler les requêtes suivantes, mais après quelques clics cette salve de plusieurs requêtes recommence.

Ce n'est donc pas bloquant, mais très pénible !

De plus, depuis la version 84, tout périphérique de sécurité enregistré et lié à un certificat sur support matériel branché fait planter le navigateur. La seule solution est de revenir à la version 83...

Pouvez-vous m'aider à comprendre d'où viennent ces dysfonctionnements svp ?

Cordialement.
creator: b_carre

title: Pages not loading correctly with 84.0.1
content:
I'm on a Mac and Firefox is my primary browser. I recently updated to Big Sur, and Firefox updated to 84.0.1 a few days later.

At first, things were fine, but something must've updated in the background because now when I go to certain websites or open certain emails, the text becomes scrambled (see attached). I've been trying to read up on what this could be and it sounds like it's possibly a javascript error. I've also read that FF is no longer supporting javascript, so my question is this: How am I supposed to access these sites and read these emails now?

I know I can use another browser and will have to until I can fix this since some of those emails are work-related, but this seems like a major flaw for something that's still widely used on sites. Is there something I'm missing? Do I need to install a plugin or something to convert/translate the code?

I've made sure that javascript is enabled through the about.config steps, but I'm not super computer-savvy and didn't want to risk bricking my machine. If anyone has any suggestions about steps I can try to resolve this, I appreciate any help you can give.

title: RoboForm Restore Previous Version Add-On
content:
Hi I have used Roboform for many years. It used to be integrated in the top row of web browsers, but due to changes in Firefox (among others) it then used a separate taskbar that appeared at the bottom of the screen. This was simple to use, but did require manually turning off at times due to some websites using the bottom of the screen for chats etc. This has just been automatically updated and is now unworkable! I only have access to one identity not four, no automatic login (such as this forum) and the need to click, click, click, click, click, etc. just to get access to a login that I now have to edit, and cut and paste manually. As it is no longer fit for purpose, I want to install a previous version with the taskbar. Does anyone have a link where I can download it from?

In the meantime, I have asked RoboForm how I can extract the data so I can move onto something that works. They have declined to reply.

Can someone please advise how I can automatically transfer the existing data into Firefox and use this for my automated ogin information. I can then use the same on my mobile devices.

Alternatively, can someone offer an alternative solution to RoboForm that works with browers and syncs to mobile devices? Regards

title: '400 Bad CSRF Token' when I try to log in to Reddit
content:
The last 2 days, when I've tried to log in to my account at reddit, it returns:

400 Bad CSRF Token

Access is denied. This server can not verify that your cross-site request forgery token belongs to your login session. Either you supplied the wrong cross-site request forgery token or your session no longer exists. This may be due to session timeout or because browser is not supplying the credentials required, as can happen when the browser has cookies turned off.

check_csrf_token(): Invalid token

I have a subreddit to moderate, so I'm using Opera for that. I'd rather use Firefox. It happens in safe mode too.

title: Down/up arrow key jumps pages instead of scrolling a few lines when reading pdf
content:
Whenever I first open a pdf, the up/down arrows work as normal (they scroll a few lines at a time), but whenever I jump to a new chapter/section using the sidebar, the up/down arrow keys just start to scroll one page at a time and I am unsure of how to fix this.

Below is a sample pdf in which this issue has occured.
creator: ChaoticCube

title: downloads when a new version of firefox is installed
content:
Every time there is a new release of firefox, i go through the same process... I install the release, all is well. i download a file and firefox does it, however it is not to where i want it. it downloads to the download folder.

It is then that I realize that the release changed my options of asking me where to download the file. If a USER has specified to be asked where to download the file, this should not be changed with every release change.

How would you like it if every release asked you what language you would like???

Once the settings are made in options, the new release should not modify it to what firefox thinks it should be.

Thanks
creator: bobpatbp
